Message.Msg: Those who are not part time without health insurance are temps who could also easily lose both job and health insurance. With that kind of insecurity, there will be little left to spend. Besides, what difference does it make if 500K jobs are added and just as many are lost - keeping the rate where it is?

Topic.Title: of course amzn will beat lowerd #

Message.Msg: They probably beat on Revenues on a pro forma basis but less likely on an apples to apples basis. See Paulo Santos recent article that explains this. Basically with one of the segments of business there is a new accounting process. The question I have is will AMZN even disclose this fairly upfront or bury it within their worsening financials/ metrics. It probably won't matter because if the market behaves this could be over $300 by then.
